argument.discription: If the opponent of the death penalty is incorrect in his belief that the death penalty doesn't deter (homicide), he is responsible for the murder of innocent individuals who would not have been murdered if the death penalty had been invoked.

statement.discription: If the opponent of the death penalty is incorrect in his belief that the death penalty doesn't deter (homicide),
Protecting the lives of innocent individuals from murder justifies the execution of murderers if other murderers are then deterred by the fear of execution.
